HPI 8291 Lancia Stratos HF 1977 Rallye Monte Carlo DNF M. Hoepfner/D. Delaunay



Marianne Hoepfner get her start in motorsport at the age of 20. Starting in rallying and hillclimbs, she moved on to circuit racing and - along with Christine Dacremont and Michèle Mouton - won the 2000cc class at Le Mans in 1975.

Hoepfner and co-driver Danièle Delaunay drove this Stratos in the 1977 Rallye Monte Carlo but retired in the second stage due to suspension failure. Their Aseptogyl teammates Christine Dacremont & Colette Galli fared better taking 6th place, also modeled by HPI.
